Posted By: ThisisSakon (1/22/2013 5:37:21 PM)

posts.post_content:
[Joraga Treespeaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Joraga Treespeaker) will get you 1 extra mana on turn 3, unless you can play a 2/2ish for 1 and a 3/3ish for 2, and will usually have lower P/T. She also gives you essentially 2 extra mana on turn 2, since you don't have to cast her. Past that point though, it's a very fast ramp if you can keep playing bigger stuff.  
  
Overall, this works very well in a Green deck not dedicated to ramp. One that plays extremely efficient creatures, along with cards with X in the cost, or just a few big things. Usually I just throw [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise) in a deck like that, but now it will be this.
posts.html:
Joraga Treespeaker will get you 1 extra mana on turn 3, unless you can play a 2/2ish for 1 and a 3/3ish for 2, and will usually have lower P/T. She also gives you essentially 2 extra mana on turn 2, since you don't have to cast her. Past that point though, it's a very fast ramp if you can keep playing bigger stuff.

Overall, this works very well in a Green deck not dedicated to ramp. One that plays extremely efficient creatures, along with cards with X in the cost, or just a few big things. Usually I just throw Birds of Paradise in a deck like that, but now it will be this.

posts.post_content:
I am not thrilled by this elf, unfortunately, because it starts of making ZERO mana. Llanowar Elf, Birds, Noble Hierarch all allow you to cast a 3cc spell on turn 2, and Gyre Sage may not even allow you to cast a 4 cc on turn 3 due to its restriction. It takes more set up and the benefit is higher in the end, but for a 2 cc mana maker I'd expect better.  
  
Her text should say, "Add G to your manapool, then another G for each +1/+1 counter on it."
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Nice card, interesting ability, **HUGE** potential.  
Slower than most mana ramp creatures, but all it needs is a [Burst of strength](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burst of strength) to get going.  
  
Also, with a [Blessings of nature](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blessings of nature), an  [Increasing savagery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Increasing savagery), or even [Hunger of the howlpack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hunger of the howlpack) (with a morbid trigger) you can pull the infinate mana combo with [Galvanic alchemist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Galvanic alchemist).  
  
**EDIT**: Whoops! I forgot that you need {U} for the alchemist's ability. My bad guys. :(
posts.html:
Nice card, interesting ability, HUGE potential.
Slower than most mana ramp creatures, but all it needs is a Burst of strength to get going.

Also, with a Blessings of nature, an Increasing savagery, or even Hunger of the howlpack (with a morbid trigger) you can pull the infinate mana combo with Galvanic alchemist.

EDIT: Whoops! I forgot that you need {U} for the alchemist's ability. My bad guys. :(

Posted By: Shadowcaster3975 (2/1/2013 6:07:03 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Ironically, I don't feel like this card is too terribly useful for a ramp deck unlike other mana elf type cards. When you play your big dudes it'll get +1/+1 counters, allowing you to play more big dudes... That you've already put into play. It's pretty nice, but there's probably other evolve creatures (like [Crocanura](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crocanura)) that'll provide better utility for that kind of deck.  
  
However, since Gyre Sage becomes better for doing things you'd normally do (i.e. curving out for a better creature each turn getting another +1 every time), I feel it'll work nicely in a deck using X costing spells, green or otherwise. So, [Rakdos' return](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rakdos' return), [Bonfire of the damned](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bonfire of the damned), [Sphinx's revelation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sphinx's revelation), [Kessig Wolfrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kessig Wolfrun) you get the idea. You'll probably have enough spare mana to be able to bypass [Frontline Medic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Frontline Medic)'s annoying counter effect as well.  
  
It died to removal? They used up a removal spell to k... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Ironically, I don't feel like this card is too terribly useful for a ramp deck unlike other mana elf type cards. When you play your big dudes it'll get +1/+1 counters, allowing you to play more big dudes... That you've already put into play. It's pretty nice, but there's probably other evolve creatures (like Crocanura) that'll provide better utility for that kind of deck.

However, since Gyre Sage becomes better for doing things you'd normally do (i.e. curving out for a better creature each turn getting another +1 every time), I feel it'll work nicely in a deck using X costing spells, green or otherwise. So, Rakdos' return, Bonfire of the damned, Sphinx's revelation, Kessig Wolfrun you get the idea. You'll probably have enough spare mana to be able to bypass Frontline Medic's annoying counter effect as well.
